CALENDARIA.Calendar.RENESCARA.Descriptio: The calendar of Renescara - 13 perfect months of 28 days each, plus the Day of Threshold
CALENDARIA.Calendar.RENESCARA.Name: Renescarran Calendar
CALENDARIA.Editor.Column.Name: Name
CALENDARIA.Editor.ConfirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This cannot be undone.
CALENDARIA.Editor.ConfirmLoadTemplate: Load "{name}" as a starting point? This will replace your current settings.
CALENDARIA.Editor.ConfirmReset: Reset the form to a blank calendar? This will clear all current settings.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Error.MinOneMonth: Calendar must have at least one month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Error.MinOneWeekday: Calendar must have at least one weekday.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Field.Name: Name
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.CycleLength: How many days for the moon to complete one full cycle.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.DaylightEnabled: When enabled, sunrise and sunset times vary throughout the year based on solstice settings.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.DaysPerYear: Total days in a non-leap year. Should match the sum of all month days.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.DaysPerYearComput: Calculated from the sum of days in all months.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Festivals: Special days that have unique names. These appear on the calendar.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.FirstWeekday: Which weekday falls on the first day of year 0.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.HoursPerDay: Number of hours in each day.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapDays: Days in this month during leap years (leave empty if same).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapGregorian: Uses Gregorian rules: divisible by 400, or by 4 but not 100. (e.g., 2000 and 2004 are leap years, 1900 is not)
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapInterval: How many years between leap years (e.g., 4 for every 4 years).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapPattern: Comma-separated intervals. Use ! prefix to exclude. Example: "400,!100,4" = Gregorian rules.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapStart: The first year that is a leap year (offset for calculations).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LongestDay: Hours of daylight on the longest day (summer solstice).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Months: Define the months of your calendar. Order matters - drag to reorder.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Moons: Configure moons and their cycles. Each moon has a reference date when it was new.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Name: This name will appear in the calendar selector.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.PhasePercentage: Start/End are percentages of the moon cycle (0% = new moon, 50% = full moon, 100% = next new moon).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.ReferenceDate: A date when this moon was new. Used to calculate current phase.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Seasons: Define seasons by day ranges. Optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.ShortestDay: Hours of daylight on the shortest day (winter solstice).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.SummerSolstice: Date when daylight is longest (summer solstice).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.System: The game world or setting this calendar is from.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Template: Load an existing calendar as a starting point for customization.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.TimeStructure: Configure how time is measured in your world.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Weekdays: Define the days of the week. The week repeats in this order.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.WinterSolstice: Date when daylight is shortest (winter solstice).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.CycleFormat: Template using {{1}}, {{2}}, etc. for each cycle's current value. Use {{n}} for line break.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Cycles: Named repeating patterns like zodiac signs or elemental weeks.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.YearZero: The year that displays as year 0 when world time starts.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.YearZeroWeekday: Which weekday falls on the first day of year zero.
CALENDARIA.Editor.LoadCalendarPrompt: What would you like to do with "{name}"?
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoEras: No eras defined. Eras are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoFestivals: No festival days defined. Festivals are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoMoons: No moons defined. Moons are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoCycles: No cycles defined. Cycles are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoSeasons: No seasons defined. Seasons are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Placeholder.Name: Enter calendar name...
CALENDARIA.Editor.SetAsActiveHint: Makes this the active calendar and reloads the world to apply the change.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Title: Create New Calendar
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddEra: Insert a new era below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddFestival: Insert a new festival below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddMonth: Insert a new month below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddSeason: Insert a new season below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddWeekday: Insert a new weekday below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddEntry: Add a new entry to this cycle.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.ClickToChange: Click to select a custom image.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CycleFormat: Template for displaying cycle values. Use {{1}}, {{2}} etc. for each cycle.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CycleLength: Length of the moon's cycle in days.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CyclePeriod: How many units before advancing to next entry. Use 1 for one entry per month/day.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CycleName: Name of this cycle (e.g., Zodiac, Elemental Week).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CycleBasedOn: What time unit the cycle is based on.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.EraEndYear: Year when this era ends. Leave empty if ongoing.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.EraFormat: How the era appears with year numbers.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.FestivalDay: Day of the month for this festival.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.FestivalName: Name of the festival or special day.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.LeapYearOnly: This festival only appears in leap years.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CountsForWeekd: If unchecked, this day exists 'outside' the week cycle and doesn't advance the weekday (e.g., Midwinter is neither Monday nor Tuesday).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MonthAbbr: Abbreviation (e.g., March → Mar) or alternative title.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MonthDays: How many days in this month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MonthLeap: Total days in this month during leap years. Leave empty if same.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MonthType: Standard: A normal month. Intercalary: Days outside the regular calendar structure (e.g., holidays between months).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MoonColor: Tint color for this moon's icon display.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.FadingName: Sub-phase name for the end of this phase (e.g., 'Fading New Moon'). Leave blank to auto-generate.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.PhaseEnd: Cycle position where this phase ends (0-100%).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.PhaseIcon: Click to select a custom icon.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.PhaseStart: Cycle position where this phase starts (0-100%).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.RisingName: Sub-phase name for the start of this phase (e.g., 'Rising New Moon'). Leave blank to auto-generate.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.RemoveEntry: Remove this entry from the cycle.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.RestDay: Mark as a rest day (e.g., weekend).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonAbbr: Abbreviation (e.g., Winter → Win) or alternative title.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonEndDay: Day of the month when this season ends. Leave empty for end of month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonStartDay: Day of the month when this season starts. Leave empty for start of month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.StartingWeekda: Force this month to always start on a specific weekday. 'Auto' uses normal weekday progression.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.WeekdayAbbr: Abbreviation (e.g., Monday → Mon) or alternative title.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Warning.DaysMismatch: Months total {calculated} days, but days per year is set differently.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Warning.TimeSettings: Changing these values may affect effect durations, system mechanics, and other features that rely on the passage of time.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoCanonicalHours: No canonical hours defined. Canonical hours are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.CanonicalHours: Named time-of-day periods (e.g., Matins, Lauds, Prime). Used in medieval/religious settings.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoNamedWeeks: No named weeks defined. Named weeks are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.NamedWeeks: Named repeating week periods (e.g., 'Week of the Harvest', 'Holy Week').
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.WeeksType: Month-based: week numbers reset each month. Year-based: continuous week count through the year.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.WeeksPerMonth: For month-based counting, how many weeks fit in each month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.WeekName: Name of this week (e.g., 'Stag Week', 'Dragon Week').
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.DateFormats: Custom templates for date display. Use {{variable}} syntax.
CALENDARIA.Editor.DateFormatVariables.De: Use {{variable}} in templates. Available: y, yyyy, B, b, m, mm, d, dd, j, w, H, h, hh, M, S, p, P, ch, chAbbr, W, WW, WN, Wn

CALENDARIA.Importer.NoData: No data loaded. Please upload a file or import from a module.

CALENDARIA.Importer.SeasonsStars.NoCalen: No active calendar found in Seasons & Stars module settings.
CALENDARIA.Importer.SeasonsStars.NotInst: Seasons & Stars module is not installed or active.

CALENDARIA.Settings.AdvanceTimeOnRest.Hi: Automatically advance world time when characters take short or long rests (dnd5e only).

CALENDARIA.Settings.CompactControlsDelay: How long (in seconds) before the compact calendar's sidebar and time controls automatically hide after the mouse leaves.

CALENDARIA.UI.AllDayTooltip: Mark this note as an all-day event
CALENDARIA.UI.ColorTooltip: Choose a color for the icon
CALENDARIA.UI.EndDateTooltip: Select end date for this note
CALENDARIA.UI.EndTimeTooltip: Set the end time for this note
CALENDARIA.UI.IconPickerTooltip: Click to choose an icon. Right-click to switch between image and font modes
CALENDARIA.UI.RandomIntervalTooltip: How often to check if the event occurs
CALENDARIA.UI.RandomProbabilityTooltip: Chance (0-100%) the event occurs each check interval
CALENDARIA.UI.RandomSeedTooltip: Seed for deterministic randomness. Same seed = same occurrences
CALENDARIA.UI.LinkedNoteTooltip: Select an event to link to. This event will occur relative to the linked event.
CALENDARIA.UI.LinkedOffsetTooltip: Days offset from the linked event. Positive = after, negative = before.
CALENDARIA.UI.MaxOccurrencesTooltip: Maximum number of times this event repeats. Leave at 0 for unlimited.
CALENDARIA.UI.RepeatTooltip: Set how often this note repeats
CALENDARIA.UI.SilentTooltip: Suppress automatic notifications when this event triggers
CALENDARIA.UI.StartDateTooltip: Select start date for this note
CALENDARIA.UI.StartTimeTooltip: Set the start time for this note
CALENDARIA.UI.TimeTooltip: Set the time of day for this note
